metadata.title: CVE-2014-3577 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier in Apache HttpComponentsHttpClient before 4.3.5 and HttpAsyncClient before 4.0.2 does not properlyverify that the server hostname matches a domain name in the subject'sCommon Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate, whichallows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via a "CN=" stringin a field in the distinguished name (DN) of a certificate, as demonstratedby the "foo,CN=www.apache.org" string in the O field.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3577` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libhttpclient-java - 4.4.1-1
libhttpmime-java - 4.4.1-1
No subscription required

libcommons-httpclient-java - 3.1-11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: httpcomponents-client package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-1').
commons-httpclient package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1-11').
